titles.title: To limit the redistricting that States may do after an apportionment of Representatives.
To limit the redistricting that States may do after an apportionment of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

bill.summary: Amends Federal law to prohibit a State that has been redistricted after an apportionment from being redistricted again until after the next apportionment of Representatives, unless the State is ordered by a Federal court to conduct such a subsequent redistricting in order to: (1) comply with the U.S. Constitution; or (2) enforce the Voting Rights Act of 1965 or otherwise enforce the voting rights of the people of the State.
